required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: An Adaptable Foot Prosthesis for People With Lower Extremity Amputations - Community Experiences

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to obtain feedback about use of a novel prosthetic foot during community mobility compared to the participant's usual prosthetic foot. To accomplish this, for the participant's usual foot and the investigational foot, participants will complete a diary about mobility, describing activities of daily living and their degree of difficulty. Global Positioning System (GPS) and accelerometer devices will monitor mobility during that time.

detailed_description.textblock:
Eligible participants will meet with a researcher and clinical prosthetist to go through the consenting process and complete a demographic data questionnaire.
The prosthetist will assess the condition and fit of the participant's current prosthesis for alignment, fit, and condition. The prosthetist will also inspect the participant's residual limb for skin condition. People with significant skin breakdown will not be eligible to participate. The prosthetist will also determine how best to set up the current socket system with the investigational foot at that time, with input from the research participant in case any special parts would need to be ordered.
Then, they will receive a GPS device and accelerometer (step-counter) with assistance in fixing it to their prosthetic limb. The ActiGraph wGT3X-BT records 3-axis accelerometer raw data as well as calculated activity output variables. The device uses Bluetooth technology to send and receive data. Written information will accompany the devices and the logbook. They will receive a hard-copy activity log to complete during the study.
A participant that completes the initial week of data collection with their usual foot will return to the University of Washington. The activity monitor and GPS will be replaced. The participant will complete the Prosthesis Evaluation standardized questionnaire. The prosthetist will fit the new, investigational prosthetic foot prior with the study participant's feedback. These are standard procedures in the prosthetic clinic. Alignment of the foot occurs in all three anatomical planes. The participant will stand and walk to verify correct alignment as evaluated by the licensed prosthetist and with subjective feedback by the participant. The participant will practice forward walking, sidesteps, up and downhills, up and down stairs, turning, and uneven ground. The participant will receive instructions on the new prosthetic foot. If there is an issue or problem the participant is instructed to telephone or email the research prosthetist.
When the prosthetist and participant are satisfied that the participant can walk well with the investigational foot, there will be a subsequent 1-week use period. The participant is encouraged to perform similar activities compared to their previous week. The participant will take their usual foot with them in case there are any problems with the investigational foot during the week. The participant will complete a new log book during that time.
After one week, the participant will again meet with the prosthetist at the University of Washington to have their usual foot re-fitted and aligned. Walking gait will be assessed. The participant will return the GPS, Actigraph and investigational foot. The participant will again complete the Prosthesis Evaluation Questionnaire based on their experiences with the investigational foot. Then the participant will be asked to participate in an exit interview. They will be asked questions about their experiences, and be asked to compare the different feet.

primary_outcome.description: Self-report questionnaire. PEQ Subscales: The PEQ is a 9-scale instrument that has good psychometric properties and has been validated. The PEQ subscales have a range from 0 (worst) to 100 (best). PEQ subscales of residual limb health, ambulation, utility, and sounds were selected for this study and comprise a total of 24 visual analogue scale questions. ICC estimates for these subscales for the first and second administration ranged from 0.79 to 0.9.(Legro et al., 1988)

arm_group.description: Community walking trial comparing usual prosthetic foot with investigational prosthetic foot.

intervention.description: Individuals will complete one week of community walking with the investigational foot and compare to their regular prosthetic foot.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Unilateral below knee amputation, use a prosthetic foot
- Ability to walk 400 meters on level ground without using a walking aid and without an increase in pain
- Ability to read, write, and comprehend English
Exclusion Criteria:
- Residual skin breakdown
- Weight over 200 lbs

reference.citation: Legro MW, Reiber GD, Smith DG, del Aguila M, Larsen J, Boone D. Prosthesis evaluation questionnaire for persons with lower limb amputations: assessing prosthesis-related quality of life. Arch Phys Med Rehabil. 1998 Aug;79(8):931-8.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Associate Professor, School of Medicine, Rehabilitation Medicine
